summary: Shift scope to build a mobile-first Indian job portal (Instant Jobs) inspired by JobHai.com with similar workflows and monetization (credits-based jobseeker profile unlock), but with original colorful branding and a traditional manual-credentials authentication system for Jobseeker/Employer/Admin plus an Admin panel to control credits and moderation.
architectural_notes: Authentication decision: remove Internet Identity; use traditional username/email + password logins with RBAC for Jobseeker/Employer/Admin.
Admin login to be supported with manual credentials (currently provided as admin@ppsjobs.com / 9277492395); ensure secrets are stored securely (not hardcoded) and support changing credentials.
known_issues: User reports that some functions are missing after deployment; needs investigation and restoration of expected functionality.
Employer panel appears to be using employee/candidate UI; needs correction to proper Employer dashboard.
Currency is displayed as $ instead of ₹ in the UI.
Employers cannot view candidate details in the candidate browsing/search (candidate directory) flow; needs a candidate detail view and/or data access fix.
Security risk to address: admin credentials were provided explicitly; must not be hardcoded or stored in plaintext—use secure storage + hashing and allow rotation.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity authentication and an app-level user model that supports two roles: Candidate and Employer. Provide a role selection/confirmation step on first sign-in and persist the chosen role for subsequent sessions.

Build public (unauthenticated) pages that mirror a job marketplace like Wrokindia.in, branded as “Instant Jobs”: a landing/home page, a job search/browse page, and a job detail page. The landing page should clearly present the two user journeys (Find Jobs / Hire Candidates) and route users appropriately.
Build Candidate features and UI: Candidate dashboard showing applied jobs, ability to apply to a job via an application form, and view application status history/current status.
Build Employer features and UI: Employer dashboard with job posting form, manage posted jobs, view applicants per job, and update applicant/application status.
Apply “Instant Jobs” branding across the entire product (name, logo, headings, metadata). Do not use “Workindia” in any user-visible content.

Establish a coherent visual theme for the clone (colors, typography, spacing, components) suitable for a modern job marketplace, and apply it consistently across pages using Tailwind + the existing UI component library.
Add generated static image assets to the frontend and render them in the UI (store under frontend/public/assets/generated). Use these assets for the product logo and landing page hero illustration.
Add a user-facing authentication UX that clearly communicates the app uses Internet Identity for login/signup (not Google OAuth), and update login-related UI copy accordingly.

Add a dedicated, easy-to-find help section (e.g., on the landing page or a small modal linked near the Login button) explaining what Internet Identity is and how to use it to create an account and sign in.

Identify which backend canister functions are reported as “missing” after the latest deployment by reproducing the issue in the running app and capturing the exact console/runtime errors (e.g., "actor.<method> is not a function" or Candid method-not-found).

Restore full parity between the frontend’s expected actor API and the backend canister’s exported Candid interface by ensuring all functions used in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts exist and are callable on the deployed canister (including chooseRole, getCallerUserProfile, saveCallerUserProfile, getJobs, getJob, getJobsByEmployer, createJob, deleteJob, applyForJob, getApplicationsForCandidate, getApplicationsForJob, updateApplicationStatus).

Add user-facing error handling for actor call failures related to missing/unsupported methods so the UI shows a clear English message (and does not silently fail) when a backend method is unavailable, including on Job detail apply, Employer job creation, and application status update actions.
Add frontend React Query hook(s) to call the new backend candidate-directory API with guarded actor-method checks and usable filter parameters.
Create an Employer-facing UI page to browse/search jobseekers with filters, and add routing/navigation so Employers can easily access it.

Replace the current Internet Identity-based authentication flow with an in-app, manual-credentials authentication system supporting three roles: Jobseeker, Employer, and Admin, and ensure all role-gated pages are inaccessible until the appropriate role is logged in.

Create an Admin Panel UI with full control over the platform: manage employers and jobseekers, manually add/deduct employer credits, set credit cost per unlock, view unlock activity logs, optionally approve/reject job postings, disable any account instantly, and show a metrics dashboard (total employers, total jobseekers, credits used, active jobs).

Update Employer-facing UI to support credits + unlocking: show available credit balance, show locked candidate cards with a clear locked state, prompt for confirmation before unlock, and after unlock reveal full candidate details and mark as unlocked permanently.

Update Job posting and browsing to match Indian job portal expectations: salary displayed in ₹ only, mobile-first card-based listings, and fast filters (location, salary, experience, process) across job browse UI.

Apply a fully custom, unique, colorful, mobile-first UI/UX theme across the app (while keeping ‘Instant Jobs’ branding), including distinct styling for employer vs jobseeker vs admin sections, without using Internet Identity-related visuals/copy.

new_feature_requests.summary: Clone Wrokindia.in (website/app functionality and UI).
Rename branding from Workindia to Instant Jobs across the cloned product.

Create the core data models and backend APIs for a job marketplace: Job (created by Employer), JobApplication (created by Candidate for a Job), and UserProfile (per principal, with role-specific fields). Include CRUD for Employer jobs, job browsing/searching for Candidates, and application submission + status updates.
Add real Google Authentication for login & signup (Google OAuth sign-in).
Fix Employer panel UI/UX so it is clearly an Employer dashboard (not resembling an employee/candidate panel).
Replace currency display from $ to ₹ across the product UI.
Develop/enable backend data storage so all app features work end-to-end (persist jobs, applications, and user profiles).
Enable Employers to access a searchable/browsable database of jobseekers (candidate directory) with filtering capabilities.
Add backend canister query API(s) that allow an authenticated Employer to browse/search a directory of all available jobseekers (Candidates) on the platform.
Allow Employers to view full candidate details from the candidate directory (candidate profile/detail view) and ensure Employers have access to the jobseeker database.
Replace Internet Identity/unsupported auth with a traditional manual-credentials authentication system for Jobseeker, Employer, and Admin (role-based access control; dashboards hidden until login).

Implement credits-based jobseeker profile unlock system: blurred/limited employer view pre-unlock, one-time unlock with no repeat deductions, permanent access post-unlock, prevent unlock if insufficient credits, confirm before unlock, transaction-safe deduction.

Build Admin panel for full control: manage employers/jobseekers, manually add/deduct employer credits, define credit cost per unlock, view unlock activity/logs, optionally approve/reject job postings, disable accounts, show key metrics dashboard.

Jobseeker module enhancements: required profile fields (name, mobile, email, company, role/process, experience, last salary ₹, preferred location, active/inactive), edit anytime, apply for jobs, view applied jobs list.

Create a fully custom, unique, colorful, mobile-first UI/UX theme (JobHai-style flows/layout cues but original branding/colors/components) including locked-profile UI states and fast filters (location/salary/experience/process).

Implement secure credential handling on the backend for manual login: store passwords as salted hashes (never plaintext), issue server-generated session tokens on successful login, validate tokens on all protected backend methods, and provide logout/token invalidation.

Add/extend backend data models to match a mobile-first Indian job portal: jobseeker profile fields (Full Name, Mobile Number, Email, Current/Last Company Name, Job Role/Process, Total Experience, Last Drawn Salary in ₹, Preferred Job Location, Active/Inactive), employer fields (Company Name, Contact Person Name, Mobile, Email, Business Location), and support editing profiles anytime.

Implement JobHai-style employer credits and candidate-profile unlock system in the backend: admin-defined credit cost per unlock, employer credit balance, one-time unlock per candidate (no repeat deduction), permanent access after unlock, prevent unlock if insufficient credits, transaction-safe deduction, and unlock logs for admin audit.

Update the employer candidate directory backend API to support limited pre-unlock views and full post-unlock views, including filter parameters (location, salary, experience, process/role) and ensuring locked fields (mobile, email, company name) are hidden until unlocked.

Add any required data migration to preserve existing canister state when changing user/auth/profile schemas (only if the current deployed state would otherwise break), following the project’s conditional migration policy.
